text: Oh this is really cool, it's like taking it back to what inspired the arrangement in the first place. Well done to Azure (and you too Supra for the riginal, of course).
author: Babybahamut

text:
I think I hear some Mario Paint in there, some DKC, some Super Mario World, and some bits of Yoshi's Island...

I'm not too sure, but it sounds good.
author: Sephiko

text:
Actually, the reason I used SNES sounds is because it's actually made on the SNES, as part of the soundtrack to a game I'm working on. I don't know what kind of level I'll put this in, but I'll make sure to tell you when I do!
Oh, and it's interesting to note that I remixed a few of the songs I found on your VGM list for it, but I never thought I'd use something from the other list. Weird how things work out sometimes, huh?
author: Azure Lazuline

text:
I personally have a hard time remixing with other things than the modern instruments I have. Both times I used NES sounds, it ended up being original compositions. I'm not sure where I could find a SNES or Genesis soundbank for me to play around with!

A Seymour Battle remix  hmmm... that would be extremely challenging!
author: SupraDarky

text: Someone actually remixed that chiptune I made a while back, with what seems to be SNES sounds. Very interesting and different. It's definitely weird for me to hear a remix of my own composition!
author: SupraDarky
